Misconfigurations.Title: Missing description for security group rule.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Violations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.

Misconfigurations.Title: A security group rule should not allow unrestricted egress to any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Description: Opening up ports to connect out to the public internet is generally to be avoided. You should restrict access to IP addresses or ranges that are explicitly required where possible.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive cidr range

Violations.Message: Security group rule allows unrestricted egress to any IP address.

Misconfigurations.Title: Security groups should not allow unrestricted ingress to SSH or RDP from any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress and egress network traffic to AWS
resources. It is recommended that no security group allows unrestricted ingress access to
remote server administration ports, such as SSH to port 22 and RDP to port 3389.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive CIDR range

Violations.Message: Security group rule allows unrestricted ingress from any IP address.
Security group rule allows unrestricted ingress from any IP address.
Security group rule allows unrestricted ingress from any IP address.
